data.title: Vocabulary: Qualifications
data.content: Qualifications refer to your education, skills, certifications, and experience that make you suitable for a job. Common qualifications include degrees, professional certifications, and years of experience.

data.target_phrase: My name is [Your Name]. I'm a [Profession] with [Number] years of experience.
data.expected_transcript: My name is I'm a with years of experience
data.instruction: Repeat after me. Fill in [Your Name], [Profession], and [Number] with your own information.
data.note: Flexible matching - focus on structure and pronunciation

data.text: In my previous role, I successfully managed a team of five people and increased sales by 20 percent.
data.expected_transcript: In my previous role I successfully managed a team of five people and increased sales by 20 percent

data.question: When asked 'What is your weakness?' in an interview, what should you do?
options: Name a real weakness and explain how you're improving it
data.explanation: It's better to be honest about a weakness while showing you're actively working to improve it. This demonstrates self-awareness and growth mindset, which employers value.
